summary:
That's me: 
Think about a sail boat: I work closely with the captain but love to be behind the steering wheel, explore and determine how we get to our destination. A sail boat can swiftly maneuver so I get things done at a high pace, not compromising on quality. I prefer to "sail"  new and unknown business territories and have impact!

Job opportunities should give a sparkle to my entrepreneurial spirit. This is the environment where I am passionate and move people I work with, being driven, creative, energetic and with the ability and pleasure to build relationships build on trust but also pleasure. My analytical skills help me to be thorough on what I do and get to the core of what's important while staying pragmatic and keeping course.

Since 2002 I've been active in the field of product/project management and strategic business development. I have a long track record in international markets (Asia / Europe). I adapt very fast to new and complex environments which give me the opportunity to offer much added value based on my experiences  within a short time frame. This is also where I get the most satisfaction. Explore and pave the way for future business success. 
 
In positions as product/solution manager and the having taken the role of Market Director I have worked on the edge working closely with external and internal stakeholders. 

In particular in recent years, I have paid a lot of attention on my personal development and my role as a leader. How can I inspire and move people so they join me on the journey that I am after. A personal coaching program has provided me with great insights and has made me much more aware of what drives me as a person and derived from that, in my professional life. 

My personality
Open, authentic, positive, hands on. 

My skills: 
Strategic business development, entrepreneurship, project management, product management,  product marketing, proposition development (PLC), sourcing / outsourcing (Asia), project management,  international trading.

Where I worked: 
Philips, Siemens VDO (Continental), GlobalMatch (owner), Essent B2B, Navco International, Vanderlande. 

Where I travelled: 
Frequent business travels to and daily communication with suppliers, business partners and sales organization in Asia, US and Europe

Industries/markets: 
My career has very much been focused around technical, B2B markets and industries, with particular experience in Intralogistics, Food retail/e-com,  Automotive, Energy (gas/electricity industry), Lighting/Consumer Electronics, International Trade.

profile_positions.description: Indentifying and realizing opportunities to strengthen the High Tech sector in Noord-Brabant which is a province in the southern part of the Netherlands. Opportunities could arise from the existing network, eg. by improving ways to collaborate or by strengthening the High Tech value chain, but also by introducing and adding new, foreign companies and expertise to the sector to create more added value. In this way the B.O.M. contributes to a sustainable competitive position for Brabant and the Netherlands as High Tech expertise base in and for Europe.
profile_positions.title: Project Manager Foreign Investments High Tech Systems Materials (HTSM)

profile_positions.description:
Commercial Solution Manager within Vanderlande, BU Warehousing and Parcel. Responsible for translating the market winning concepts, validated insights and segment specific needs into business cases aimed at developing and introducing market leading solutions.

My responsibilities:
- Define new product ideas based on deep customer insights and in close collaboration with market directors and other product and innovation managers.

- Play a key role within the product development process of material handling solutions, by translating validated market and customer needs into business cases, supporting customer segmentation and targeting in selected market segments and by driving technology USPs and value propositions to develop corresponding positioning and messaging

- Actively support the Strategic Officer, Market Directors and local sales organizations with the execution of market and product introductions.

- Develop profound understanding of the financial performance of the product portfolio under the CSM responsibility during commercial product life cycle.

- Ensure proper execution of Product Development and Market Introduction processes. 

About Vanderlande:
Vanderlande is the global market leader for value-added logistic process automation at airports, and in the parcel market. The company is also a leading supplier of process automation solutions for warehouses. 

The company focuses on the optimisation of its customers’ business processes and competitive positions. Through close cooperation, it strives for the improvement of their operational activities and the expansion of their logistical achievements. Vanderlande’s extensive portfolio of integrated solutions – innovative systems, intelligent software and life-cycle services – results in the realisation of fast, reliable and efficient automation technology.
profile_positions.title: Commercial Solution Manager

profile_positions.description:
As OES Project & Sourcing Manager, I am responsible to realize end to end solutions where I have the integral responsibility to manage the process throughout the complete value chain as T1 supplier in automotive.

We bring innovation to automotive by managing as T1 supplier the development, production and distribution of integrated and customized solutions. As OES project leader, I am project related contact window towards our customers (eg Nissan, Renault, Mazda, Subaru) and responsible to manage the activities within our team as well as the project activities towards our T2 suppliers which are mainly based in Asia. This also includes finding new T2 suppliers and manage the communication on a day to day basis.

Background Navco International:
Since 2008, Navco International has been an important and leading partner for the automotive aftermarket. Navco International focusses exclusively on supplying integrated solutions to the car importer market (on national levels) and increasingly  also on European HQ level) for OES/OEM programs.

We are always looking for new opportunities to introduce customized and integrated solutions for the car importer market by working closely with car importers and the carefully selected manufacturing partners and suppliers of Navco International.
profile_positions.title: OES Project and Sourcing Manager

profile_positions.description:
As product manager within the PM team, I was responsible for developing new commercial propositions (Energy: Gas) for the professional market. In this position I had the integral responsibility to manage the product development projects in close cooperation with a wide variaty of departments including eg. sales, sourcing/SPM, legal, finance, IT and customer service departments.

Objective was to develop strong new commercial propositions that were rolled out to the market in cooperation with sales where at the same time, the underlying products had to be embedded in the organisational structure and processes. Given the needs of the different market segments and eg. key accounts, it was a challenging job where I had to balance continuously between customization and standardization. The job also gave me a perfect insight in the complex financial market structure that is an essential part of the industry and therefore also part of the products and propositions that we developed. 
 
Background Essent:
Essent is part of the RWE group and one of the key energy suppliers in the Netherlands. Within Essent, there's a special business unit responsible for supplying energy to the professional market, called Essent B2B. Essent B2B markets different sources of energy including gas, electricity and sustainable energy.
profile_positions.title: Product Manager Business to business

profile_positions.description:
I developed an e-commerce platform through which consumers in the USA could order their official Philips Lighting replacement lamps for digital rear projection televisions. 

In cooperation with e-fulfillment partners in the US and Philips, a special web shop was developed to enable online sales of official Philips Lighting products. In 2010, the activity was officially transferred to the US partners that further build the business from there. 

Background TVsparelamps;
TVsparelamps was a custom made e-commerce  solution for Philips Lighting, developed for the US B2C market.
profile_positions.title: Owner

profile_positions.description:
As co-owner and partner of GlobalMatch, I experienced the entrepreneurial environment to the fullest. With a business partner, we started GlobalMatch from scratch and we focussed on trading with Asia (primarily China). 

From our 3 office locations, Tilburg (the Netherlands), Shanghai (China) and HongKong, we managed and coordinated different customer projects. These varied from initiating  manufacturing processes for new products to sourcing of existing products. During the first 2 years, my primary responsibility was sales management from our office in Tilburg but I frequently travelled to China to visit our suppliers and jointly coordinate the souring process. 

In the the last year of GlobalMatch, I became full owner and managed both the sales as well as the sourcing acitities in China in cooperation with our staff in the Shanghai office.

Background GlobalMatch:
GlobalMatch focussed sourcing and outsourcing services for European and US based companies that wanted to start up cooperation with Chinese manufacturers and suppliers. 

Besides providing services, GlobalMatch also acted as a trading partner for some of her customers where GlobalMatch became the EU importer for several products.
profile_positions.title: Owner

profile_positions.description:
I worked within Siemens VDO (currently Continental) as product manager for the business line responsible for fleet management and professional navigation systems. Most important personal achievement during my period within Siemens VDO was the introduction of a new web based fleet management service (FM-Web).

In my position as product manager I coordinated several projects which required close communication with distributions partners and sales, Siemens VDO HQ in Switzerland, and internal departments such as sales & finance. 

Reason to stay with Siemens VDO for a relative short time was that I got a great opportunity to start my own company, GlobalMatch. This made me decided not to pass on that opportunity and follow my entrepreneurial ambition. 

Background Siemens VDO Trading
Siemens VDO Trading was the Dutch national sales office of Siemens VDO. Besides the professional (B2B) market, Siemens VDO also distributed consumer navigation systems (VDO Dayton) towards the retail (CE & automotive) channel. Special projects like customized and integrated navigation solutions, mainly for national car importers, were also part of the business activities.
profile_positions.title: Commercial Product Manager

profile_positions.description:
Product Marketing Specialist for MD-PTV products. 

Background Philips (BU: UHP)
Philips developed lamp systems that were used in digital projection applications. As product marketeer I was responsible for defining future product road map together with development and product life cycle management. In addition, as product marketeer I was able to visit OEM customers in Asia in order to discuss new design in opportunities/projects.

In my first 2 years, I also coordinated the trade shows and exhibitions (eg Infocomm) that Philips UHP participated in as exhibitor.  

Main personal achievement is the introduction and commercial roll out of UHP Vidi, a new rear projection lighting solution for the OEM market.
